snippet: United Nations officials attributed at least part of the increase to politicians’ need for campaign cash during the protracted election season.
abstract: United Nations officials report that Afghan opium cultivation rose to historic levels in 2014, and that country's protracted elections in 2014 were part of the cause; lengthy election led to greater need for campaign funding and attendant use of illegal fundraising, highlighting entanglement of drug trafficking and Afghan political system.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul.

lead_paragraph: United Nations officials attributed at least part of the increase to politicians’ need for campaign cash during the protracted election season.

headline.main: Afghan Opium Cultivation Rises to Record Levels
